{{See also|Human shields (law)}} {{other uses}} [[File:Human shield - S. Solomko.jpg|thumb|''Human shield'' war postcard by Sergey Solomko ]] '''Human shield''' is a military and political term describing the deliberate placement of [[non-combatant]]s in or around combat targets to deter the enemy from attacking these combat targets. It may also refer to the use of persons to literally shield [[combatant]]s during attacks, by forcing them to march in front of the combatants.
Using this tactic is considered a [[war crime]] by nations that are parties to the 1949 [[Geneva Conventions]], the 1977 [[Protocol I|Additional Protocol I to the Geneva Conventions]], and the 1998 [[Rome Statute]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.icrc.org/customary-ihl/eng/docs/v2_rul_rule97 |title=Practice Relating to Rule 97. Human Shields |publisher=[[International Committee of the Red Cross]] |access-date=2015-01-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140804142107/http://www.icrc.org/customary-ihl/eng/docs/v2_rul_rule97 |archive-date=2014-08-04 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref>
== 20th century == [[File:The Barricade by George Wesley Bellows - BMA.jpg|thumb|230px|''The Barricade'' by the American artist [[George Bellows]] inspired by an incident in August 1914 where German soldiers used [[Rape of Belgium|Belgian civilians as human shields]].]]
===World War II=== After [[World War II]], it was claimed by [[Germany|German]] [[SS]] general [[Gottlob Berger]] that there was a plan, proposed by the [[Luftwaffe]] and approved by [[Adolf Hitler]], to set up special [[POW camp]]s for captured [[airmen]] of the [[Royal Air Force]] and the [[United States Army Air Forces]] in large German cities, to act as human shields against their [[bombing raid]]s. Berger realized that this would contravene the [[Geneva Convention (1929)|1929 Geneva Convention]] and argued that there was not enough barbed wire—as a result, this plan was not implemented.<ref>Berger statement to Allied intelligence officers, Nuremberg, 19 October 1945</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.penguin.co.uk/nf/Book/BookDisplay/0,,9780141003887,00.html |title=The Last Escape |work=Penguin Books UK |accessdate=1 April 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140220065054/http://www.penguin.co.uk/nf/Book/BookDisplay/0%2C%2C9780141003887%2C00.html |archivedate=20 February 2014 |df= }}</ref>
[[Wehrmacht]] and later SS forces extensively used Polish civilians as human shields during [[Warsaw Uprising]] when attacking the insurgents' positions.<ref>{{pl icon}} Adam Borkiewicz: Powstanie warszawskie. Zarys działań natury wojskowej. Warszawa: Instytut wydawniczy PAX, 1969, p. 99</ref><ref>Antoni Przygoński: Powstanie warszawskie w sierpniu 1944 r. T. I. Warszawa: PWN, 1980, p. 242. {{ISBN|83-01-00293-X}}.</ref>
At the [[Wola massacre]] in Poland on 7 August 1944, the Nazis forced civilian women onto the armored vehicles as human shields to enhance their effectiveness. In Belgium in May 1940, at least 86 civilians were killed by the German [[Wehrmacht]] known as the [[Vinkt Massacre]], when the Germans took 140 civilians and used them as shields to cross a bridge while under fire.
During the [[Battle of Okinawa]], Japanese soldiers often used civilians as human shields against American troops.
When the Japanese were concerned about the incoming Allied air raids on their home islands as they were losing their controlled Pacific islands one by one to the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] in the [[Pacific War]], they scattered major [[military installations]] and [[factory|factories]] throughout [[urban area]]s, therefore, historians argued that Japan was using its civilians as human shields to protect their [[legitimate military target]]s against Allied [[bombardment]]. As a result, the [[U.S. Army Air Forces]] (USAAF) was unable to strike purely military targets due to the limitations of their [[bombsight]], the mixing of military installations and factories with urban areas, and the widespread of [[cottage industry]] in Japan's cities. This led the USAAF in early 1945 to switch from [[precision bombing]] to [[carpet bombing]] which destroyed [[Air Raids on Japan|67 Japanese cities]] with [[incendiary bombs]] and the use of [[atomic bombs]] on the Japanese cities of [[Hiroshima and Nagasaki]].<ref>{{cite book |page=26 |title=Rockets from Gaza: Harm to Civilians from Palestinian Armed Groups' Rocket Attacks |author=Bill Van Esveld |publisher=[[Human Rights Watch]] |date=August 17, 2009 |isbn=1-56432-523-7}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |page=335 |title=The Library of Congress World War II Companion |author=[[Library of Congress]] |publisher=[[Simon & Schuster]] |date=October 2, 2007 |isbn=0-7432-5219-5}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |page=817 |title=History of World War II: Victory and Aftermath |publisher=[[Marshall Cavendish Corporation]] |year=2005 |isbn=0-7614-7482-X}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |page=72 |title=The Law of Air Warfare - Contemporary Issues |publisher=Eleven International Publishing |year=2006 |isbn=90-77596-14-3}}</ref>
===Korean War=== In the [[Battle of the Notch]] North Korean forces were claimed to have used captured U.S. soldiers as human shields while advancing.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Appleman |first1=Roy E. |title=South to the Naktong, North to the Yalu: United States Army in the Korean War |date=1998 |publisher=Department of the Army |isbn=978-0-16-001918-0 |page=240 |url=http://www.history.army.mil/books/korea/20-2-1/toc.htm |accessdate=17 October 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102112322/http://www.history.army.mil/books/korea/20-2-1/toc.htm |archive-date=2 November 2013 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===1982 Lebanon War=== During the [[1982 Lebanon War]], the Palestinian refugee camp of [[Ain al-Hilweh]] was surrounded by Israeli forces as the last stronghold of Palestinian militants in southern Lebanon, but "Soldiers of Allah" militants commanded by the Muslim fundamentalist Haj Ibrahim refused to surrender: Their motto was "Victory or death!" Over a two-day period, Israeli forces under the leadership of Brigadier General [[Yitzhak Mordechai]] repeatedly announced "Whoever does not bear arms will not be harmed" and urged civilians in the camp to evacuate, but few did. Three delegations of prominent [[Sidon]] figures were sent to persuade Haj Ibrahim's fighters that "their cause was hopeless, and whoever was willing to lay down his arms would be allowed to leave the camp unharmed." None of the delegations were successful; the first was prevented from approaching the fighters by "a spray of bullets," while the third "returned with the most harrowing tale of all": "Militiamen were shooting civilians who tried to escape. In one particularly grisly incident, three children had been riddled with bullets before their parents' eyes because their father had dared to suggest calling an end to the fighting." After a delegation of Palestinian [[Prisoner of war|POWs]]—"headed by a [[Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO]] officer who was prepared to give the defenders his professional assessment of Ein Hilweh's grave military situation"—and an offer by Mordechai to "meet personally with" Haj Ibrahim were also rebuffed, "a team of psychologists ... was flown to Sidon to advise the command on how to deal with such irrational behavior." However, "the best advice the psychologists could offer was to organize yet another but considerably larger delegation comprising some forty or so people and including women and children"; Haj Ibrahim responded to the fifth delegation with "exactly the same three words"—triggering a bloody battle in which Israeli troops finally took the camp.<ref>{{cite book|authorlink1=Ze'ev Schiff|last1=Schiff|first1=Ze'ev|authorlink2=Ehud Yaari|last2=Ya'ari|first2=Ehud|title=Israel's Lebanon War|publisher=Simon and Schuster|year=1984|isbn=0-671-47991-1|pp=144–150}}</ref>
===Operation Blue Star=== [[Operation Blue Star]] was an Indian military operation carried out between 1 and 8 June 1984, ordered by [[Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister]] [[Indira Gandhi]] to remove militant religious leader [[Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale]] and his armed followers from the buildings of the [[Harmandir Sahib]] complex in [[Amritsar]], [[Punjab, India|Punjab]]. Bhindranwale and large number of his militants were killed in the operation. There was a high civilian casualty (Total 493 including militants) also in the operation, since the militants had been using the [[pilgrim]]s that had been trapped inside the temple as Human shields.<ref name="Kiss_Khalistan">{{cite book |last1=Kiss |first1=Peter A. |title=Winning Wars amongst the People: Case Studies in Asymmetric Conflict |date=2014 |publisher=Potomac Books |isbn=9781612347004 |page=100 |edition=Illustrated |url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=uIY6AwAAQBAJ&lpg=PA100&dq=khalistani%20currency%20bhindranwale&pg=PA100#v=onepage&q=khalistani%20currency%20bhindranwale&f=false |accessdate=15 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180715235735/https://books.google.co.in/books?id=uIY6AwAAQBAJ&lpg=PA100&dq=khalistani%20currency%20bhindranwale&pg=PA100#v=onepage&q=khalistani%20currency%20bhindranwale&f=false |archive-date=15 July 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The pilgrims were not allowed by the militants to escape from the temple premises in spite of relaxation in the curfew hours by the security forces.<ref name=ms_curfew>{{cite book | last = Mark Tully | first = Satish Jacob | title = Amritsar; Mrs. Gandhi's Last Battle | url = https://books.google.co.in/books?id=bxhuAAAAMAAJ&focus=searchwithinvolume | year = 1985 | location = London | edition = e-book | access-date = 2018-07-08 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20180706191120/https://books.google.co.in/books?id=bxhuAAAAMAAJ&focus=searchwithinvolume | archive-date = 2018-07-06 | dead-url = no | df = }}</ref> The militants had hoped that the presence of thousands of pilgrims inside the temple premises would have prevented the action by army.<ref name="hindus_Karim">{{cite book |last1=Karim |first1=Afsir |title=Counter Terrorism, the Pakistan Factor |date=1991 |publisher=Lancer Publishers |isbn=9788170621270 |page=33 |url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=QoqwQb38SQEC |accessdate=15 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180715235814/https://books.google.co.in/books?id=QoqwQb38SQEC |archive-date=15 July 2018 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
===Persian Gulf War=== One of the most famous uses of human shields occurred in [[History of Iraq under Ba'athist rule|Iraq]] in 1990, following the [[Invasion of Kuwait|Iraqi invasion]] of [[Kuwait]] that precipitated the [[Gulf War|Gulf War of 1990-1991]]. [[Saddam Hussein]]'s government detained hundreds of citizens of [[Western world|Western]] countries who were in Iraq for use as human shields in an attempt to deter nations from participating in military operations against the country. A number of these [[hostage]]s were filmed meeting Hussein, and kept with him to deter any targeted attacks, whilst others were held in or near military and industrial targets.<ref name="BBCOTD">BBC News. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/august/23/newsid_2512000/2512289.stm 1990: Outrage at Iraqi TV hostage show] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080201022736/http://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/august/23/newsid_2512000/2512289.stm |date=2008-02-01 }}". Retrieved 2 September 2007.</ref>
In 1991, during the operations in the Gulf War, the U.S. submitted a report to the [[UN Security Council]] denouncing Iraq for having “intentionally placed civilians at risk through its behavior”. The report cited the following examples of such behavior:
*(a) The Iraqi Government moved significant amounts of military weapons and equipment into civilian areas with the deliberate purpose of using innocent civilians and their homes as shields against attacks on legitimate military targets; *(b) Iraqi fighter and bomber aircraft were dispersed into villages near the military airfields where they were parked between civilian houses and even placed immediately adjacent to important archaeological sites and historic treasures; *(c) Coalition aircraft were fired upon by anti-aircraft weapons in residential neighborhoods in various cities. In Baghdad, anti-aircraft sites were located on hotel roofs; *(d) In one case, military engineering equipment used to traverse rivers, including mobile bridge sections, was located in several villages near an important crossing point. The Iraqis parked each vehicle adjacent to a civilian house.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.icrc.org/customary-ihl/eng/docs/v2_cou_us_rule23 |title=United States of America Practice Relating to Rule 23. Location of Military Objectives outside Densely Populated Areas |publisher=[[International Committee of the Red Cross]] |access-date=2013-10-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012072427/http://www.icrc.org/customary-ihl/eng/docs/v2_cou_us_rule23 |archive-date=2013-10-12 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref>
=== Bosnian war === Shortly after the cease-fire between Croat and Serb forces, the [[Bosnian Serbs]] launched an assault against the safe area of [[Goražde]], heavily shelling the town and surrounding villages. Protests and exhortations from the [[UN Security Council]] turned out to be ineffective, and on 10 and 11 April 1994, [[NATO]] launched air strikes against Bosnian Serb positions. In retaliation, Bosnian Serb forces captured many UN personnel, using them as human shields at sites expected to be bombed. In a similar situation to what had happened in [[Sarajevo]], an ultimatum was issued, and by the 24th, most of the Serb troops had complied.
== 21st century ==
===War in Afghanistan=== According to various accounts—including that of the American ambassador to the U.N., the Taliban used women and children from their own population as human shields against coalition forces in 2006,<ref>"[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/article676588.ece Taleban use children as shields to fight British"], ''[[The Times]] online'', June 20, 2006</ref> and 2007,<ref>"[http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2007/07/03/1968077.htm Taliban 'using civilians as human shields'"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080725234204/http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2007/07/03/1968077.htm |date=2008-07-25 }}, ''[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC Australia]]'' 2007</ref> and when the British attacked during August 2008 during the [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|war in Afghanistan]].<ref>Thomas Harding.[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/onthefrontline/2579282/Taliban-used-civilians-as-human-shields-when-British-attacked.html "Taliban 'used civilians as human shields' when British attacked"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171110111704/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/onthefrontline/2579282/Taliban-used-civilians-as-human-shields-when-British-attacked.html |date=2017-11-10 }}, ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'', August 18, 2008</ref>
===Israeli-Palestinian conflict===
==== Israel ==== {{See also|Criticism of Israel#"Neighbor Procedure"}} According to [[B'tselem]], Israel repeatedly used Palestinians as human shields since the outset of the military occupation of the Palestinian territories in 1967. This practice became military policy during the [[Al-Aqsa intifada|second Intifada]], and was only dropped when [[Adalah]] challenged the practice before Israel’s High Court of Justice in 2002. though the IDF persisted in using Palestinians in its 'neighbor procedure', whereby people picked at random were made to approach the houses of suspects and persuade them to surrender, a practice which arguably placed the former's lives in danger. The court ruled in October 2005 'that any use of Palestinian civilians during military actions is forbidden, including the “prior warning procedure”.' According to B'tselem, reports indicate that the practice has continued nonetheless, in military operations like [[Operation Cast Lead]], and [[Operation Protective Edge]], and the 'vast majority of these reports were never investigated, and those that did resulted in no further action.' <ref>[https://www.btselem.org/human_shields 'Human Shields'] [[B'tselem]] 11 November 2017.</ref> =====During the Second Intifada=====
According to Israeli defense officials, the [[Israel Defense Forces]] made use of the "human shield" procedure on 1,200 occasions during the [[Second Intifada]] (2000-2005), and only on one occasion did a Palestinian civilian get hurt.<ref name=ban>{{cite news|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3154142,00.html|title=Mofaz: IDF to appeal 'human shield' ruling|date=11 October 2005|publisher=Yediot Aharonot|access-date=23 July 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727183853/http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3154142,00.html|archive-date=27 July 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="BT" >[http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/world-news/israelgaza-idf-used-palestinians-as-human-shields-1200-occasions-in-last-five-years-say-israeli-defence-officials-30483468.html 'Israel-Gaza: IDF used Palestinians as human shields 1,200 occasions in last five years, say Israeli defence officials,'] Belfast Telegraph 12 October 2005</ref>
According to human rights groups [[Amnesty International]]<ref>{{cite web | title = Israel and the Occupied Territories Shielded from scrutiny: IDF violations in Jenin and Nablus | publisher = Amnesty International | date = 4 November 2002 | url = https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde15/143/2002/en/ | accessdate = 2007-09-09 | df = }}</ref> and [[Human Rights Watch]],<ref name="hrw.org">[[Human Rights Watch]], ''Jenin: IDF Military Operations'', [http://hrw.org/reports/2002/israel3/israel0502-06.htm] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924171600/http://www.hrw.org/reports/2002/israel3/israel0502-06.htm |date=2015-09-24 }} "VII. Human Shielding and the Use of Civilians for Military Purposes", May 2002.</ref> the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) used [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] civilians as human shields during the 2002 [[Battle of Jenin]]. The Israeli [[human rights]] group [[B'Tselem]] said that "for a long period of time following the outbreak of the second intifada, particularly during [[Operation Defensive Shield]], in April 2002, the IDF systematically used Palestinian civilians as human shields, forcing them to carry out military actions which threatened their lives".<ref name="B'Tselem">[[B'Tselem]], [http://www.btselem.org/english/Human_Shields/20060720_Human_Shields_in_Beit_Hanun.asp] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110604232204/http://www.btselem.org/english/Human_Shields/20060720_Human_Shields_in_Beit_Hanun.asp |date=2011-06-04 }} "Israeli Soldiers use civilians as Human Shields in Beit Hanun", ''B'Tselem'', July 20, 2006.</ref><ref>[http://domino.un.org/UNISPAL.NSF/85255db800470aa485255d8b004e349a/48a40ca00c3be03d85256c910074441f!OpenDocument]{{dead link|date=July 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} UN Doc. Chronological Review of Events November 6, 2002, ''A military court in Israel sentenced two junior officers to 28 days imprisonment because they had used Palestinian civilians as "human shields", Israel Radio reported. A platoon sergeant who had made a navigation error and ended up in a Palestinian village with his soldiers had forced a villager to drive them to a safe place, the radio said. During the sergeant's investigation, a similar incident had come to light in the same battalion, during which a squad commander had made a Palestinian drive him and his soldiers to safety.''</ref> [[Al Mezan]] reported the systematic use of "human shields" during the [[Raid on Beit Hanoun (2004)|invasion of Beit Hanoun]] in 2004.<ref name=mezan-paper>{{cite web |url=http://www.mezan.org/upload/2619.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131021163100/http://www.mezan.org/upload/2619.pdf |archivedate=2013-10-21 |df= }} "A paper on the IOF Invasion of the town of Beit Hanoun (29 June – 5 August 2004)", ''Al Mezan Center for Human Rights'', 12 August 2004. On {{cite web |url=http://www.mezan.org/en/details.php?id=2619&ddname=crimes&id_dept=22&id2=9&p=center |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131021163015/http://www.mezan.org/en/details.php?id=2619&ddname=crimes&id_dept=22&id2=9&p=center |archivedate=2013-10-21 |df= }}<br />"Another 36 homes were occupied by Israeli soldiers and used as watch posts. In every case of home occupation the IOF detained the inhabitants inside one room of the house"</ref> Human shields were also employed by Israeli soldiers to subdue a stone-throwing protest in [[Hebron]] in 2003.<ref name=IDF2003>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jan/02/israel1|title=Israel's human shields draw fire|date=2 January 2003|publisher=The Guardian|access-date=14 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170915170945/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/jan/02/israel1|archive-date=15 September 2017|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2002 the Supreme Court of Israel issued a temporary injunction banning the practice in the wake of the death of a Nidal Abu Mohsen (19) who was shot dead when he was forced by the IDF to knock on the door of his neighbor, Hamas militant Nasser Jarrar, in the West Bank village of [[Tubas]] and inform him of the Israeli army's demands that he surrender.<ref name="BT" /><ref name="BBCNews" /><ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/2195155.stm 'Israeli army accused of new killing,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160917193434/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/2195155.stm |date=2016-09-17 }} BBC News 16 August 2002.</ref>
In 2004, a 13-year-old boy, Muhammed Badwan, was photographed tied to an Israeli police vehicle in the West Bank village of [[Biddu, Jerusalem|Biddu]] being used as a shield to deter stone-throwing protesters.<ref name="BT" /><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-115890185.html|title=The Day Israel Used a Boy Aged 13 as a Human Shield; Teenager Tied to Police Vehicle to Stop His Friends Throwing Stones|date=April 23, 2004|publisher=Daily Mail|author=Matthew Kalman|access-date=August 12, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140921122016/http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-115890185.html|archive-date=September 21, 2014|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-X_yEHXXxK00/UH3HG_uGwEI/AAAAAAAAKBw/L4IhER5Gz40/s1600/The+day+Israel+used+a+boy+aged+13+as+a+human+shield.jpg |title=Archived copy |access-date=2014-09-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140920055606/http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-X_yEHXXxK00/UH3HG_uGwEI/AAAAAAAAKBw/L4IhER5Gz40/s1600/The+day+Israel+used+a+boy+aged+13+as+a+human+shield.jpg |archive-date=2014-09-20 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> Rabbi [[Arik Ascherman]] was placed under arrest after he tried to intervene.<ref name="BBCNews">[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3650791.stm 'Israel faces human shield claim,'] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160917193312/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3650791.stm |date=2016-09-17 }} [[BBC News]] 23 April 2004</ref>
In 2005, Israel's High Court of Justice banned the practice,<ref name=ban /><ref name="haaretz.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/idf-to-ask-high-court-to-review-ban-on-human-shield-practice-1.171689|title=IDF to ask High Court to review ban on 'human shield' practice|date=11 October 2005|work=Haaretz.com|accessdate=1 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402121923/http://www.haaretz.com/news/idf-to-ask-high-court-to-review-ban-on-human-shield-practice-1.171689|archive-date=2 April 2015|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> with the [[Israeli Defense Ministry]] appealing the decision.<ref name=ban /><ref>{{cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/4333982.stm | work=BBC News | title=IDF to appeal human shield ban | date=October 12, 2005 | access-date=April 11, 2011 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090119231317/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/4333982.stm | archive-date=January 19, 2009 | dead-url=no | df=mdy-all }}</ref> While acknowledging and defending the "use of Palestinians to deliver warnings to wanted men about impending arrest operations", a practice known in Israel by the euphemism "neighbor procedure",<ref name=IDF2003 /> the IDF denied reports of "using Palestinians as human shields against attacks on IDF forces", claiming it had already forbidden this practice.<ref name="haaretz.com"/>
In 2006, however, initial investigations by [[B'Tselem]] indicated that the IDF might have used civilians as human shields in 2006 [[Beit Hanun]].<ref>[http://www.btselem.org/human_shields/20060720_human_shields_in_beit_hanun] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808233139/http://www.btselem.org/human_shields/20060720_human_shields_in_beit_hanun |date=2014-08-08 }} — "Human rights groups on the attack on Gaza B'Tselem: Israeli soldiers use civilians as human shields in Beit Hanun", ''B'Tselem'', 20 July 2006</ref>
In February 2007, footage was released of an incident involving Sameh Amira, a 24-year-old Palestinian, who video showed serving as a human shield for a group of Israeli soldiers, getting inside apartments suspected to belong to Palestinian militants ahead of the soldiers.<ref name="CBS"/><ref>[http://www.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_5644167] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927231157/http://www.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_5644167 |date=2007-09-27 }} "Israelis use Palestinian as human shield", ''[[The Denver Post]]'', April 12, 2007.</ref> A 15-year-old cousin of Amira and an 11-year-old girl in the West Bank independently told B'Tselem in February 2007 that Israeli soldiers forced each of them in separate incidents to open the door of a neighboring apartment belonging to a suspected militant, get inside ahead of them, and open doors and windows.<ref name=BT2007>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2007/mar/09/israel|title=Israel accused of using Palestinian children as human shields|date=9 March 2007 <!-- 11.48 -->|publisher=The Guardian|access-date=14 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161231023201/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2007/mar/09/israel|archive-date=31 December 2016|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The Israeli Army launched a criminal investigation into the incident involving Amira.<ref name="CBS"/> In April 2007, the Israeli army suspended a commander after the unit he was leading was accused of using Palestinians as human shields in a [[West Bank]] operation.<ref name="BBC NEWS">[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/6554487.stm] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070717154742/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/6554487.stm |date=2007-07-17 }}, "Israel Human Shield Suspension", ''BBC News'', April 14, 2007</ref> In April 2007 [[CBS News]] reported that, according to human rights groups, the IDF did not stop the use of human shields, but the incidence was dropping.<ref name="B'Tselem"/><ref name="CBS">[http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2007/04/11/world/main2674604.shtml] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100216010506/http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2007/04/11/world/main2674604.shtml |date=2010-02-16 }} "Israel Probes "Human Shield" Allegations", ''CBS News'', 11 April 2007.</ref>
=====During the 2008–2009 Gaza War=====
During the [[Gaza War (2008–09)|2008-2009 Gaza War]] known as [[Operation Cast Lead]], Israeli military forces were accused of continuing to use civilians as human shields by [[Amnesty International]] and [[Breaking the Silence (non-governmental organization)|Breaking the Silence]].<ref name=breaking>{{cite news|title=Breaking silence on Gaza abuses|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8151336.stm|publisher=BBC News|date=15 July 2009|access-date=18 July 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090717225955/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8151336.stm|archive-date=17 July 2009|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> According to testimonies published by these two groups, Israeli forces used unarmed Palestinians including children to protect military positions, walk in front of armed soldiers; go into buildings to check for booby traps or gunmen; and inspect suspicious objects for explosives.<ref name=breaking /><ref>Amnesty International Report "Operation Cast Lead": 22 Days of Death and Destruction pg 48-50, {{cite web |url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde15/015/2009/en/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-03-16 |df= }}</ref> [[Amnesty International]] stated that it found cases in which "Israeli troops forced Palestinians to stay in one room of their home while turning the rest of the house into a base and sniper position, effectively using the families, both adults and children, as human shields and putting them at risk".<ref>[https://www.amnesty.org/en/news-and-updates/report/impunity-war-crimes-gaza-southern-israel-recipe-further-civilian-suffering-20090702] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100121013127/http://www.amnesty.org/en/news-and-updates/report/impunity-war-crimes-gaza-southern-israel-recipe-further-civilian-suffering-20090702 |date=2010-01-21 }} "Impunity for War Crimes in Gaza-Southern Israel a Recipe for Further Civilian Suffering", ''Amnesty International''.</ref> The [[UN Human Rights Council]] also accused Israel of using human shields during 2008-2009 Gaza Conflict.<ref>James Bone. [http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/middle_east/article6835910.ece] "UN accuses Israel of committing war crimes in Gaza", ''The Times'', 16 September 2009</ref><ref>Associated Press report, [http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2009/10/16/2009-10-16_un_human_rights_council_endorses_gaza_war_crimes_report_demands_israel_hamas_inv.html] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091017235130/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2009/10/16/2009-10-16_un_human_rights_council_endorses_gaza_war_crimes_report_demands_israel_hamas_inv.html |date=2009-10-17 }} "UN Human Rights Council endorses Gaza war crimes report, demands Israel, Hamas investigate", ''New York Daily News'', 16 October 2009</ref>
''[[The Guardian]]'' compiled three videos and testimony from civilians about alleged war crimes committed by Israeli soldiers during the 2008-2009 Gaza War, including the use of Palestinian children as human shields.<!-- Doublette on sourced guardian <ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/series/gaza-war-crimes-investigation] "Gaza War Crimes Investigation", ''The Guardian'', March 2009</ref> --> In the videos three teenage brothers from the al-Attar family claimed that they were forced at gunpoint to kneel in front of tanks to deter Hamas fighters from firing at them and that they were used to "clear" houses for the Israeli soldiers.<ref name="gazahumanshield">{{cite news |title=Guardian investigation uncovers evidence of Israeli war crimes in Gaza |first=Clancy |last=Chassay |publisher=[[The Guardian]] |date=2009-03-23 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/23/israel-gaza-war-crimes-guardian |location=London |access-date=2014-08-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140825065121/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/23/israel-gaza-war-crimes-guardian |archive-date=2014-08-25 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref>
An IDF soldier's testimony for Breaking the Silence told that his commander ordered that for every house raided by the IDF, they send a "neighbor" to go in before the soldier, sometimes while the soldier placed his gun on the neighbor's shoulder;<ref name=breakingbbc>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8151611.stm|title=Israel soldiers on Gaza: Excerpts|date=15 July 2009|publisher=BBC News|access-date=21 August 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140125144257/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8151611.stm|archive-date=25 January 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> according to the soldier, "commanders said these were the instructions and we had to do it".<ref name=breakingbbc /> Gazan civilians also testified of being used at gunpoint as human shields by Israeli soldiers.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8151336.stm|title=Breaking silence on Gaza abuses|publisher=BBC News|date=15 July 2009|access-date=18 July 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090717225955/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/8151336.stm|archive-date=17 July 2009|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> An Israeli military official responded to these allegations: "The IDF operated in accordance with the rules of war and did the utmost to minimise harm to civilians uninvolved in combat. The IDF's use of weapons conforms to international law." An Israeli embassy spokesperson alleged Hamas pressured the people of Gaza into making those accusations.<ref name="gazahumanshield" />

=====2009–2014 Gaza War=====
A United Nations human rights body accused Israeli forces in June 2013 of "continuous use of Palestinian children as human shields and informants", voicing with deep concern 14 such cases had been reported between January 2010 and March 2013. It says almost all accused soldiers involved in the incidents have gone unpunished.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/06/20/us-palestinian-israel-children-idUSBRE95J0FR20130620|title=Palestinian children tortured, used as shields by Israel: U.N.|date=June 20, 2013|publisher=Reuters|access-date=March 6, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150307030422/http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/06/20/us-palestinian-israel-children-idUSBRE95J0FR20130620|archive-date=March 7, 2015|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In an interview with Breaking the Silence, a former Israeli soldier recounted that the commander of his unit employed the policy, despite acknowledging its ban, as he would rather that a Palestinian civilian be killed carrying out the duty than one of his men.<ref name=french>{{cite news|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/proche-orient/article/2012/08/21/temoignages-de-violences-envers-les-enfants-palestiniens_1748121_3218.html|title=Israeli soldiers testify about violence against Palestinian children|date=2012-08-21|publisher=[[Le Monde]]|quote=One of the soldiers testifies that a procedure, though banned, [is still] used when the army comes to arrest a Palestinian suspect: soldiers send a neighbor, charged with asking the residents of the besieged house to come out. "I think that happened in Tulkarem. We made everyone come out, without finding the person we were looking for. So we sent the neighbors in, and afterwards a child. He had to make a tour inside the house, open all the doors and windows, lit all the lights." The commander of the unit said the procedure was illegal. "He declared he would rather that a neighbor be killed (…) if that made it possible to avoid one of his men from being shot while entering the house", said the soldier. The population has no choice but to cooperate. "When you knock on the door at night, with your gun shining under their face, your flashlight on their eyes, and you see he is not armed(…), he won't tell you he doesn't want to cooperate."|language=French|access-date=2014-08-20|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140821152506/http://www.lemonde.fr/proche-orient/article/2012/08/21/temoignages-de-violences-envers-les-enfants-palestiniens_1748121_3218.html|archive-date=2014-08-21|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> He told young Palestinian boys were also used by this particular unit to carry out military duties for the Israeli army.<ref name=french />
[[Defense for Children International]]-Palestine reported 17-year-old, Ahmad Abu Raida (also:''“Reeda”''),<ref name=euromid/> was kidnapped by Israeli soldiers, who, after beating him up and threatening him, at times with sexual overtones,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/25/world/middleeast/gaza-strip-palestinian-teenager-cites-ordeal-as-captive-of-israelis-soldiers.html|title=Teenager Cites Ordeal as Captive of Israelis|date=August 24, 2014|publisher=New York Times|author1=FARES AKRAM|author2=JODI RUDOREN|access-date=March 2, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170519030648/https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/25/world/middleeast/gaza-strip-palestinian-teenager-cites-ordeal-as-captive-of-israelis-soldiers.html|archive-date=May 19, 2017|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> used him as a human shield for five days, forcing him to walk in front of them with police dogs at gunpoint, search houses and dig in places soldiers suspected there might be tunnels.<ref name=euromid /><ref>[http://www.dci-palestine.org/documents/israeli-forces-use-palestinian-child-human-shield-gaza Israeli forces use Palestinian child as human shield in Gaza] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140828012953/http://www.dci-palestine.org/documents/israeli-forces-use-palestinian-child-human-shield-gaza |date=2014-08-28 }} Defence for Children International Palestine Retrieved 22 August 2014</ref> The New York Times stated that his assertions could not be independently corroborated; the Israeli military confirmed that he had been detained, noting his father's affiliation with Hamas, who was a senior official in the Gaza Tourism Ministry.<ref name=NYT-Raida>{{cite news|last1=AKRAM|first1=FARES and JODI RUDOREN|title=Teenager Cites Ordeal as Captive of Israelis|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/25/world/middleeast/gaza-strip-palestinian-teenager-cites-ordeal-as-captive-of-israelis-soldiers.html?_r=0|accessdate=19 November 2014|issue=Middle East|publisher=The New York Times Company|date=August 24, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129132714/http://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/25/world/middleeast/gaza-strip-palestinian-teenager-cites-ordeal-as-captive-of-israelis-soldiers.html?_r=0|archive-date=29 November 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> No material evidence of the physical violence allegedly suffered by Raida, e.g. photos, medical reports or lingering wounds resulting from repeated blows, was produced.<ref name=WP-NoEvidence>{{cite news|last1=Bernstein|first1=Prof. David|title=Why would the NY Times publish an uncorroborated allegation from the son of a top Hamas official?|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/volokh-conspiracy/wp/2014/08/24/why-would-the-new-york-times-publish-an-uncorroborated-allegation-from-the-son-of-a-senior-hamas-official/|accessdate=19 November 2014|issue=The Volokh Conspiracy|publisher=The Washington Post|date=August 24, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129114956/http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/volokh-conspiracy/wp/2014/08/24/why-would-the-new-york-times-publish-an-uncorroborated-allegation-from-the-son-of-a-senior-hamas-official/|archive-date=29 November 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The [[Euro-Mid Observer for Human Rights]] published testimony that, during the 2014 Gaza War, Israeli soldiers used Palestinian civilians as shield in Khuza'a. A family, that also gave a video interview, recorded by Media Town, told the group that Israeli soldiers had killed the family's patriarch, a 65-year-old who was carrying a white flag, and proceeded to place family members, including children, by the house's windows and shoot from behind them.<ref name=euromid>{{cite report|url=http://www.euromid.org/en/article/597|title=Euro-Mid Documents Israel’s Use of Human Shields in Gaza|date=2014-08-10|publisher=Euro-Mid Observer for Human Rights|access-date=2014-08-21|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140821211022/http://www.euromid.org/en/article/597|archivedate=2014-08-21|deadurl=no|df=}}</ref>
A UN official made the accusation that Israel used a school in Gaza as a military base.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.jerusalemonline.com/news/world-news/the-israeli-connection/a-un-official-israel-has-turned-a-gaza-school-into-a-military-base-8030|publisher=Euro-Mid Observer for Human Rights|title=A UN official: "Israel has turned a Gaza school into a military base"|date=9 September 2014|access-date=5 January 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151121131132/http://www.jerusalemonline.com/news/world-news/the-israeli-connection/a-un-official-israel-has-turned-a-gaza-school-into-a-military-base-8030|archive-date=21 November 2015|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== Palestinians ====
Israeli writer Amos Harel in [[Haaretz]] alleged that during the [[Second Intifada]] (2000–2005) Palestinian gunmen routinely used civilians and children as human shields and further alleges that there is photographic evidence.<ref name="Harel">{{cite web | url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/analysis-stoking-an-appetite-for-revenge-1.116136 | title=Analysis / Stoking an appetite for revenge | publisher=[[Haaretz]] | date=August 3, 2004 | accessdate=September 30, 2011 | author=Harel, Amos | quote=The photographs from recent operations show that the armed Palestinians use the many civilians in the area, including children, as a "human shield". Since this is done routinely, harming children (some, it is possible, by Palestinian fire) becomes almost impossible to prevent. | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121128004947/http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/analysis-stoking-an-appetite-for-revenge-1.116136 | archive-date=November 28, 2012 | dead-url=no | df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On 22 November 2006, Human Rights Watch (HRW) accused Muhammad Wail Baroud, a military commander in the Popular Resistance Committee, of using civilians for shielding homes against military attacks but later stated that they erred. There was no evidence that the house was being used for military purposes at the time of the planned attack, nor did the IDF explain what military objective it could have had. They considered the destruction in light of Israel's longstanding policy of [[House demolition in the Israeli–Palestinian conflict|destroying homes]] as punitive measures instead of as legitimate military targets. HRW acknowledged they did not consider the motives of the civilians, such as whether they willingly assembled or not, and emphasized that it did not want to criticize non-violent resistance or any other form of peaceful protest, including civilians defending their homes.<ref>[https://www.hrw.org/news/2006/12/15/human-rights-watch-statement-our-november-22-press-release ''Human Rights Watch Statement on our November 22 Press Release''] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121007101734/http://www.hrw.org/news/2006/12/15/human-rights-watch-statement-our-november-22-press-release |date=2012-10-07 }}. Human Rights Watch, 15 December 2006</ref>
=====During the 2008–2009 Gaza War=====
The [[United Nations Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict]] ("UNFFMG") that took place in 2008-2009 accepted the possibility that Hamas launched mortar attacks from the vicinity of a school and from residential homes, sometimes by threat of force against residents. The UN Mission found evidence that "rocket units of the Palestinian armed groups operated from within populated areas" and used threats of force to enter residential yards, including one instance where a resident said that "his father had previously been shot in the leg by a member of such an armed group when he had tried to prevent them from using his land as a rocket launching site." Similarly, the report found evidence that Palestinian militants "fir[ed] a rocket from a courtyard of a Government school in Gaza City at a time when the schools were closed."<ref>''[http://daccess-ods.un.org/access.nsf/Get?Open&DS=A/HRC/12/48&Lang=E]''Report of the United Nations Fact-Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict Paragraph 444, 447</ref>
The report was unable to find specific evidence that civilians whose homes were used for rocket launches were "forced to remain in their houses" but the report repeatedly noted that Gaza residents were "reluctant" to discuss the conduct of Palestinian armed forces due to fear of reprisals. Some witnesses stated that they had stayed in their homes because they "did not think they would be at risk as long as they remained indoors or because they had no safe place to go."<ref>''[http://daccess-ods.un.org/access.nsf/Get?Open&DS=A/HRC/12/48&Lang=E]''Report of the United Nations Fact-Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict Paragraph 35, 438, 453, 475</ref> Similarly, an [[Amnesty International]] report in 2009 criticized [[Hamas]] for human rights violations including launching missiles from homes, but found no evidence that Palestinian fighters "directed civilians to shield military objectives from attacks" or "forced them" to stay in buildings used by militants. <ref name=afp>{{cite news|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jc0DHbDsRG83m4stW9JdpHz3hxSw |title=Amnesty accuses Israel of using human shields in Gaza |date=5 July 2009 |publisher=Agence France Presse |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090705234403/https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jc0DHbDsRG83m4stW9JdpHz3hxSw |archivedate=July 5, 2009 }}</ref>
A review article in ''Case Western Reserve Journal of International Law'' stated that Israel warned residents to leave by using warnings such as [[roof knocking]] and phone calls, and that "Israel asserted that Palestinian civilians who did not abide by the warnings were acting as 'voluntary human shields,' and were thus taking part in hostilities and could be targeted as combatants." The article determined this assertion to be unsupportable in international law.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Sterio|first1=Milena|title=The Gaza Strip: Israel, its Foreign Policy and the Goldstone Report|journal=Case Western Journal of International Law|date=2010|volume=229|pages=244–245|url=http://engagedscholarship.csuohio.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1193&context=fac_articles|access-date=2015-08-13|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151121203041/http://engagedscholarship.csuohio.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1193&context=fac_articles|archive-date=2015-11-21|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>
The [[Foreign relations of Israel|Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] says Hamas now regularly uses human shields to protect the homes of Hamas officials.<ref>[http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Terrorism-+Obstacle+to+Peace/Hamas+war+against+Israel/Hamas+exploitation+of+civilians+as+human+shields+-+Photographic+evidence.htm Hamas exploitation of civilians as human shields: Photographic evidence] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111018011032/http://www.mfa.gov.il/MFA/Terrorism-+Obstacle+to+Peace/Hamas+war+against+Israel/Hamas+exploitation+of+civilians+as+human+shields+-+Photographic+evidence.htm |date=2011-10-18 }} [[Foreign relations of Israel|Israeli Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] March 6, 2008</ref> The Israeli [[Intelligence and Terrorism Information Center]] accused Hamas and other armed groups of making extensive use of human shields as integral part of their war doctrine, in order to prevent the IDF to target them, during the [[Gaza War (2008-2009)]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.terrorism-info.org.il/malam_multimedia/English/eng_n/pdf/g_report_e1.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=June 14, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110813152033/http://www.terrorism-info.org.il/malam_multimedia/English/eng_n/pdf/g_report_e1.pdf |archivedate=August 13, 2011 }}</ref> The IDF released footage allegedly showing Palestinian fighters using ambulances for military purposes. [[Magen David Adom]], the Israeli ambulance and medical emergency service, submitted to the UN a report concluding the accusation was unfounded.<ref name=UNFFMGCReportp144>{{cite web|url=http://image.guardian.co.uk/sys-files/Guardian/documents/2009/09/15/UNFFMGCReport.pdf|title=Report of the United Nations Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict, 2009, p. 144.|author=|date=|website=guardian.co.uk|access-date=2009-09-15|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091007095811/http://image.guardian.co.uk/sys-files/Guardian/documents/2009/09/15/UNFFMGCReport.pdf|archive-date=2009-10-07|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref>
Amnesty International investigated the repeated claims by Israel that Hamas was guilty of using human shields after the cessation of hostilities and found no evidence that Hamas or other Palestinian fighters "directed the movement of civilians to shield military objectives from attacks" however, as noted, many refused to speak with the UN and Amnesty and the evidence of the use of residential facilities is ample. <ref name="NF2018">[[Norman Finkelstein]],[https://books.google.com/books?id=qo84DwAAQBAJ&pg=PA70 ''Gaza: An Inquest into Its Martyrdom,''] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180731004846/https://books.google.com/books?id=qo84DwAAQBAJ&pg=PA70 |date=2018-07-31 }} [[University of California Press]], 2018 pp.68-81 pp.70-71,p.70.</ref> The same organization asserted that "there was ample evidence to indicate that, in defiance of IDF rules, Israeli soldiers had used Palestinian civilians and children as shields to protect themselves" by sending Palestinians into homes where other militants were located and to encourage their surrender. <ref name="NF2018" /><ref>{{citation|url=https://www.amnesty.org/download/Documents/48000/mde150152009en.pdf|title=Israel/Gaza - Operation "Cast Lead": 22 days of death and destruction|publisher=Amnesty International|date=2 July 2009|access-date=24 May 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170311090242/https://www.amnesty.org/download/Documents/48000/mde150152009en.pdf|archive-date=11 March 2017|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In relation to [[Al-Fakhura school incident]] during the [[Gaza War (2008–09)|Gaza War]] of January 2009, Israel accused Hamas of "cynically" using civilians as human shields. A UN Board of Inquiry found that there was no firing from within the school and no explosives within the school. The Board could not establish with certainty whether there had been any firing from the vicinity of the school.<ref name=DCI>[http://www.dci-pal.org/english/display.cfm?DocId=1235&CategoryId=1 ''Operation Cast Lead: 16-year-old killed while playing nearby UNRWA school shelled by Israeli tanks''] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100704025425/http://www.dci-pal.org/english/display.cfm?DocId=1235&CategoryId=1 |date=2010-07-04 }}, DCI-Palestine, 28 May 2009</ref>
=====During the 2014 Gaza War=====
The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights [[Navi Pillay]] accused Hamas militants of violating international humanitarian law by "locating rockets within schools and hospitals, or even launching these rockets from densely populated areas."<ref name=AP-warcrimes>{{cite web|last1=DEITCH|first1=IAN and IBRAHIM BARZAK|title=Israel vows to destroy Hamas tunnels, deaths spike|url=https://news.yahoo.com/israel-vows-destroy-hamas-tunnels-deaths-spike-214755183.html|website=https://news.yahoo.com|publisher=ap.org|accessdate=8 August 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812195149/http://news.yahoo.com/israel-vows-destroy-hamas-tunnels-deaths-spike-214755183.html|archive-date=12 August 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The [[European Union]] condemned Hamas, and in particular condemned "calls on the civilian population of Gaza to provide themselves as human shields."<ref name="ejpress.org"/><ref name="European Union 2014"/> [[France24]] confirmed the use of [[urban warfare]], filming a rocket launch pad which was placed in a civilian area next to a hotel where international journalists were staying.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20140805-exclusive-video-hamas-rocket-launching-pad-near-gaza-homes-un-building/|title=Exclusive: Hamas rocket launch pad lies near Gaza homes|date=7 August 2014|publisher=France24|access-date=12 August 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811163355/http://www.france24.com/en/20140805-exclusive-video-hamas-rocket-launching-pad-near-gaza-homes-un-building/|archive-date=11 August 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> [[Peter Stefanovic]] of Australia’s [[Nine News]] tweeted that rockets had been fired "over our hotel from a site about two hundred metres away. So a missile launch site is basically next door.” Janis Mackey Frayer of Canada's CTV reported seeing a Hamas gunman dressed in a woman's headscarf with a "tip of a gun poked out from under cloak.” Harry Fear reporting for Russia Today tweeted that rockets were fired from near his hotel.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Gaza-reporters-tweets-Hamas-using-human-shields-368689|title=Gaza reporters’ tweets: Hamas using human shields|date=24 July 2014|publisher=Jerusalem Post|access-date=30 July 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729225445/http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Gaza-reporters-tweets-Hamas-using-human-shields-368689|archive-date=29 July 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His tweet was later deleted, and he was expelled from Gaza. Several journalists who alleged Hamas use of human shields and rocket locations close to civilian infrastructure reported being threatened by Hamas.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Journalists-threatened-by-Hamas-for-reporting-use-of-human-shields-369619|title=Journalists threatened by Hamas for reporting use of human shields|date=31 July 2014|publisher=Jerusalem Post|access-date=10 July 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710234855/http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Journalists-threatened-by-Hamas-for-reporting-use-of-human-shields-369619|archive-date=10 July 2015|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In a September 2014 interview, a Hamas official acknowledged to [[Associated Press]] that the group fired at Israel from civilian areas.<ref name=aphaaretz /> He ascribed the practice to "mistakes", but said the group had little option due to the crowded landscape of the Strip, with its dearth of open zones. He denied accusations that rockets were launched "from schools or hospitals when in fact they were fired 200 or 300 meters (yards) away".<ref name=aphaaretz>{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.615478|title=Hamas acknowledges its forces fired rockets from civilian areas|date=September 12, 2014|publisher=Haaretz|access-date=September 12, 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140912225049/http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.615478|archive-date=September 12, 2014|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> In a 2014 interview, a Hamas political leader Khaled Meshaal said to a CNN interviewer that the group did not use its people as human shields.
In interviews with Gazan refugees, reporters for ''[[The Independent]]'' and ''The Guardian'' concluded it was a "myth" that Hamas forced civilians to stay in areas under attack against their will; many refugees told them they refused to heed the IDF's warnings because even areas Israel had declared safe for refugees had been shelled by its forces.<ref>{{cite report|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israelgaza-conflict-the-myth-of-hamass-human-shield-9619810.html|title=Israel-Gaza conflict: The myth of Hamas’s human shields|date=21 July 2014|publisher=The Independent|access-date=31 July 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140725012047/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israelgaza-conflict-the-myth-of-hamass-human-shield-9619810.html|archivedate=25 July 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite report|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jul/24/gaza-hamas-fighters-military-bases-guerrilla-war-civilians-israel-idf|title=In Gaza, Hamas fighters are among civilians. There is nowhere else for them to go|publisher=The Guardian|author=Harriet Sherwood|date=24 July 2014|access-date=31 July 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140730042226/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jul/24/gaza-hamas-fighters-military-bases-guerrilla-war-civilians-israel-idf|archivedate=30 July 2014|deadurl=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The BBC Middle East editor Jeremy Bowen also said he "saw no evidence of Hamas using Palestinians as human shields".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newstatesman.com/world-affairs/2014/07/jeremy-bowens-gaza-notebook-i-saw-no-evidence-hamas-using-palestinians-human|title=Jeremy Bowen's Gaza notebook: I saw no evidence of Hamas using Palestinians as human shields|date=22 July 2014|publisher=[[New Statesman]]|access-date=25 July 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140727001453/http://www.newstatesman.com/world-affairs/2014/07/jeremy-bowens-gaza-notebook-i-saw-no-evidence-hamas-using-palestinians-human|archive-date=27 July 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> An Amnesty International document (dated July 25, 2014) asserts that they do "not have evidence at this point that Palestinian civilians have been intentionally used by Hamas or Palestinian armed groups during the current hostilities to “shield” specific locations or military personnel or equipment from Israeli attacks."<ref name="MDE 15/017/2014">''[https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde15/017/2014/en/]''Document - Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories: Israel/Gaza conflict, July 2014</ref> Amnesty International's assessment was that international humanitarian law was clear in that "even if officials or fighters from Hamas or Palestinian armed groups associated with other factions did in fact direct civilians to remain in a specific location in order to shield military objectives from attacks, all of Israel’s obligations to protect these civilians would still apply."<ref name="MDE 15/017/2014" /> The human rights group, however, still found that Palestinian factions, as in previous conflicts, launched attacks from civilian areas.<ref name="MDE 15/017/2014" />
Hamas Arabic-speaking spokesman [[Sami Abu Zuhri]] called up Gaza civilians on Hamas’s [[Al-Aqsa TV]] July 8, 2014 to stay put in areas under fire by Israel,<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eQ6S0-o3uFI|title=Hamas Spokesman Sami Abu Zuhri: Human-Shield Policy Is Effecive|date=9 July 2014|work=YouTube|accessdate=1 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150309072636/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eQ6S0-o3uFI|archive-date=9 March 2015|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jbKcw6BkKEo|title=Hamas spokesman calls on Palestinians to create human shields|date=14 July 2014|work=YouTube|accessdate=1 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140719092952/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jbKcw6BkKEo|archive-date=19 July 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> prompting accusations from Israel and |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141231235450/http://ejpress.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=49892 |date=December 31, 2014 }}, [[European Jewish Press]], 22 July 2014.</ref><ref name="European Union 2014">[http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.606703 European Union: Hamas, other Gaza terror groups must disarm] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150405055122/http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.606703 |date=2015-04-05 }}, [[Haaretz]], 22 July 2014.</ref> — that Hamas was Soldier|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183617#.U-TRV9ZVKls|website=israelnationalnews.com/News/|publisher=AFP & Arutz Sheva|accessdate=8 August 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810223107/http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183617#.U-TRV9ZVKls|archive-date=10 August 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> For Amnesty
